      • executeCreateView

        public static void executeCreateView(java.lang.String query,
                                     java.lang.String dbName)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        If the SQL begins with a CREATE keyword, then this query should be executed and committed first before other queries execute. This is needed when TEMP views are created.
        Parameters:
        query - SQL to execute (beginning with CREATE)
        dbName - Database name to execute on.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Error with the SQL query being executed.

      • select

        public static void select(java.lang.String query,
                          java.lang.String database,
                          java.io.File pg_results,
                          boolean printOutput)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Execute standard read SQL statement.
        Parameters:
        query - SQL statement
        database - Database to execute statement on.
        pg_results - File to store the results.
        printOutput - Set to true if the output of the SQL statement should be stored in a local file.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if there is an error in the SQL statement.

      • getQueryResult

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getQueryResult(java.lang.String query,
                                                                                         java.sql.Statement stm)
                                                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Obtain results from the database (along with additional metadata such as the columns returned).
        Parameters:
        query - SQL to execute.
        stm - Internal JDBC statement.
        Returns:
        List of the results and column names.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Error with the SQL.

      • createInsert

        static void createInsert(java.lang.String query)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method for creating an SQL statement object from an SQL argument, and then executing it.
        Parameters:
        query - SQL to run against the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Error in query argument, not valid SQL or database error.

      • insertOrDelete

        public static void insertOrDelete(java.lang.String query,
                                  java.lang.String dbName)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method for executing an SQL statement which will either insert or delete records.
        Parameters:
        query - SQL statement to execute.
        dbName - Database name of the database to execute the statement on.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Error with the transaction.
